dn33:3.2.37_0: There are sentient beings that have gone totally beyond the dimension of infinite space. Aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, they have been reborn in the dimension of infinite consciousness.
dn33:3.2.38_0: This is the seventh lost opportunity.

dn33:3.2.42_0: This is the ninth section for seven days.

dn33:3.3.10_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
dn33:3.3.11_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has good friends, companions, and associates.
dn33:3.3.12_0: They have good friends, companions, and associates.
dn33:3.3.13_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
dn33:3.3.14_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is easy to admonish, having qualities that make them easy to admonish. They’re patient, and take instruction respectfully.
dn33:3.3.16_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
dn33:3.3.17_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is deft and tireless in a diverse spectrum of duties for their spiritual companions, understanding how to go about things in order to complete and organize the work.
dn33:3.3.18_0: It is enough for a mendicant to inspire their spiritual companions.
dn33:3.3.19_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
dn33:3.3.1_0: There are teachings grouped by ten that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
dn33:3.3.20_0: Furthermore, a mendicant loves the teachings and is a delight to converse with, being full of joy in the teaching and training.
dn33:3.3.21_0: Such a mendicant is full of joy,
dn33:3.3.22_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
dn33:3.3.23_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is content with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick,
dn33:3.3.25_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
dn33:3.3.26_0: Furthermore, a mendicant lives with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They are strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.
dn33:3.3.28_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
dn33:3.3.29_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is mindful. They have utmost mindfulness and alertness, and can remember and recall what was said and done long ago.
dn33:3.3.2_0: You should all recite these in concert.
dn33:3.3.31_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
dn33:3.3.32_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
dn33:3.3.34_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.

dn33:3.3.46_0: Ten ways of doing unskillful deeds.
dn33:3.3.47_0: Killing living creatures, stealing, and sexual misconduct.
dn33:3.3.48_0: Ten ways of doing skillful deeds.
dn33:3.3.49_0: refraining from killing living creatures, stealing, and sexual misconduct; avoiding speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical; contentment, good will, and right view.
dn33:3.3.4_0: Ten qualities that serve as protector.
dn33:3.3.51_0: A mendicant has given up five factors, possesses six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has unsullied intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is well freed in mind and well freed by wisdom.
dn33:3.3.52_0: And how has a mendicant given up five factors?
dn33:3.3.53_0: Take a mendicant who has given up sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
dn33:3.3.54_0: That’s how a mendicant has given up five factors.
dn33:3.3.55_0: And how does a mendicant possess six factors?
dn33:3.3.56_0: Take a mendicant who, when they see a sight with their eyes, is neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
dn33:3.3.57_0: When I heard a sound with my ears ...
dn33:3.3.58_0: When they know a thought with their mind, they’re neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
dn33:3.3.59_0: That’s how a mendicant possesses six factors.
dn33:3.3.5_0: Firstly, a mendicant is ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places.
dn33:3.3.5_1: Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
dn33:3.3.60_0: And how has a mendicant a single guard?
dn33:3.3.61_0: It’s when a mendicant’s heart is guarded by mindfulness.
dn33:3.3.62_0: That’s how a mendicant has a single guard.
dn33:3.3.63_0: And how does a mendicant have four supports?
dn33:3.3.64_0: After appraisal, a mendicant uses some things, endures some things, avoids some things, and gets rid of some things.
dn33:3.3.65_0: That’s how a mendicant has four supports.
dn33:3.3.66_0: And how has a mendicant eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth?
dn33:3.3.67_0: Take a mendicant who, the various ascetics and brahmins have eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth. They’ve given up the stain of all.
dn33:3.3.68_0: That’s how a mendicant has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth.
dn33:3.3.69_0: And how is a mendicant grinded in the majority?
dn33:3.3.6_0: A mendicant is ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
dn33:3.3.70_0: It’s when they’ve given up searching for sensual pleasures, for continued existence, and for a spiritual path.
dn33:3.3.71_0: That’s how a mendicant is crowded by brim.
dn33:3.3.72_0: And how does a mendicant have unsullied intentions?
dn33:3.3.73_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up intentions of sensuality, malice, and cruelty.
dn33:3.3.74_0: That’s how a mendicant has unsullied intentions.
dn33:3.3.75_0: And how is a mendicant physical process?
dn33:3.3.76_0: Giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, a mendicant enters and remains in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
dn33:3.3.77_0: That’s how a mendicant has physical process.
dn33:3.3.78_0: And how is a mendicant well freed in mind?
dn33:3.3.79_0: Take a mendicant whose mind is freed from greed, hate, and delusion.
dn33:3.3.7_0: This rule too is to serve a protector.
dn33:3.3.80_0: That’s how a mendicant is well freed in mind.
dn33:3.3.81_0: And how is a mendicant well freed by wisdom?
dn33:3.3.82_0: A mendicant understands: ‘I’ve given up greed, hate, and delusion, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so they’re unable to arise in the future.’
dn33:3.3.83_0: ‘I’ve given up hate, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.’
dn33:3.3.84_0: ‘I’ve given up delusion, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so they’re unable to arise in the future.’
dn33:3.3.85_0: That’s how a mendicant’s mind is well freed by wisdom.
dn33:3.3.87_0: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.
dn33:3.3.88_0: Reverends, these are the teachings grouped by ten that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
dn33:3.3.89_0: You should all recite this in concert, without disputing, so that this spiritual path may last for a long time.”
dn33:3.3.8_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned.
dn33:3.4.1_0: Then the Buddha got up and said to Venerable Sāriputta,
dn33:3.4.3_0: It’s good that you’ve taught this exposition of the reciting in concert.”
dn33:3.4.4_0: That is what Venerable Sāriputta said, and the teacher approved.
dn33:3.4.5_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what Venerable Sāriputta said.
dn33:3.4.6_0: The tenth section on Recitation is finished.
